For instructions on using the new TrueCrypt GUI, please see <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/TrueCrypt|TrueCrypt GUI]]</nowiki>

There is <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Security|a lot of documentation]]</nowiki> on how to create an encrypted volume. However, a significant problem caused by most of the existing implementations is that the owner of the data may be forced to reveal the password used to encrypt the data.

To address this, different projects exist to implement some <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steganography|steganography]]</nowiki> mechanisms. <nowiki>[[http://www.truecrypt.org|TrueCrypt]]</nowiki> is an open-source disk encryption software implementing steganography but as of 7.1 dose not fully support Ubuntu due to an incompatible license and only limited features & documentation are available on Ubuntu.

It is important that you keep a dummy OS and destroy or hide(usb flash drive buried in the garden) the TrueCrypt boot data, otherwise there is no plausible deniability.

== TrueCrypt 7.1 volume example ==

<pre>
mkdir /opt/truecrypt
cd /opt/truecrypt
wget "http://www.truecrypt.org/download/truecrypt-7.1-linux-console-x86.tar.gz"
tar -xvvf truecrypt-7.1-linux-console-x86.tar.gz 
cd ./truecrypt-7.1-setup-console-x86 
bash ./truecrypt-7.1-setup-console-x86
cd ../
rm truecrypt-7.1-linux-console-x86.tar.gz
rm -r truecrypt-7.1-setup-console-x86

truecrypt --help |less

truecrypt --create-keyfile --random-source=/dev/urandom test_truecrypt.key

truecrypt --filesystem=none --volume-type=normal --encryption=AES --hash=SHA-512 --random-source=/dev/urandom --quick --keyfiles=test_truecrypt.key --password=Test_pa55word -c /dev/sdb5

truecrypt --keyfiles=test_truecrypt.key --password=Test_pa55word --filesystem=none --protect-hidden=no /dev/sdb5

truecrypt --list

mkfs.ext4 /dev/mapper/truecrypt1
mkdir /media/tc1
mount /dev/mapper/truecrypt1 /media/tc1

</pre>

== TrueCrypt 4.3a hidden volume example ==

More information is available at <nowiki>[[http://www.truecrypt.org/hiddenvolume.php]]</nowiki>.

0. Download and install <nowiki>[[http://www.truecrypt.org|Truecrypt]]</nowiki>

0. Create an outer volume (ex: on ''/dev/sdb1''):<pre>
truecrypt --filesystem none --type normal --encryption AES --hash SHA-1 --random-source /dev/urandom -c /dev/sdb1 
truecrypt --text --filesystem=none --volume-type=normal --encryption=AES --hash=SHA-1 --random-source=/dev/urandom -c /dev/sdb1
</pre>
0. Map the corresponding volume (ex: on ''/dev/sdb1''), but do not mount it:<pre>
truecrypt /dev/sdb1
truecrypt --text --list #To see where was this mounted (/dev/mapper/truecrypt0 or /dev/loop0)
</pre>
0. Format outer volume '''with FAT''':<pre>
sudo mkfs.vfat /dev/mapper/truecrypt0
</pre>
0. Dismount the volume:<pre>
truecrypt -d
</pre>
0. Create a (ex: 50M) hidden volume within the outer volume (ex: on ''/dev/sdb1''):<pre>
truecrypt --filesystem none --type hidden --size 50M --encryption AES --hash SHA-1 --random-source /dev/urandom -c /dev/sdb1
</pre>
0. Map the corresponding hidden volume (ex: on ''/dev/sdb1''), but do not mount it:<pre>
truecrypt /dev/sdb1 # (use the hidden password)
</pre>
0. Format the hidden volume with a filesystem recognised by ''mount(8)'':<pre>
sudo mkfs.xfs /dev/mapper/truecrypt0
</pre>
0. Dismount the hidden volume:<pre>
truecrypt -d
</pre>
0. Mount the outer volume (ex: ''/dev/sdb1'' on ''/mnt/tc'') with the hidden volume protected:<pre>
truecrypt -P /dev/sdb1 /mnt/tc
</pre>
0. Copy files to the outer volume:<pre>
cp outer_volume_file.txt /mnt/tc
</pre>
0. Dismount the outer volume:<pre>
truecrypt -d
</pre>
0. Mount either volume (ex: ''/dev/sdb1'' on ''/mnt/tc'') and enjoy:<pre>
truecrypt /dev/sdb1 /mnt/tc # (use the password relevant to the volume you want to mount)
</pre>
